String.string: Crystals for You!
Charms for You!
Tanking Crystals for You!
DPS Crystals for You!
MP Crystals for You!
Defense Crystals for You!
Green Crystals for You!
Noctenium Infusions for You!
Crystalbinds for You!

Red crystals can be equipped on weapons; blue crystals can be equipped on armor. Red crystals provide various attack-related effects. Blue crystals provide various defense-related effects. Right-click a crystal in your Inventory to equip it.
Use charms at a campfire to provide beneficial effects related to combat. (Remember that nearby players are also affected by the charm.)

Threatening crystals are must-haves for warriors and lancers. These crystals allow you to gain more aggro, prompting enemies to attack you instead of your teammates. This lets your party members focus on dealing damage and healing. Right-click these crystals in your Inventory to equip them.

Carving crystals, savage crystals, focused crystals, and bitter crystals are must-haves for archers, berserkers, gunners, reapers, slayers, and sorcerers. These crystals maximize damage from your attacks to an opponent's rear! Right-click these crystals in your Inventory to equip them.

Brilliant crystals and swift crystals are must-haves for mystics and priests. These crystals help supply you with a steady supply of MP to power your support skills, as well as making you more mobile. Right-click these crystals in your Inventory to equip them.
Relentless crystals and hardy crystals can help increase your survivability. Right-click these crystals in your Inventory to equip them.
Green crystals can be equipped on some accessories. Look for rings and earrings with crystal slots. Right-click a crystal in your Inventory to equip it.

Noctenium infusions make your skills temporarily more effective. Right-click a stack of infusions in your Inventory to activate them. An infusion is consumed each time you use an enhanced skill, so try not to waste them!

Crystalbinds prevent crystal breakage. Normally, your equipped crystals get destroyed when you die, but crystalbinds get destroyed instead of the crystal itself. Crystalbinds are consumables, but complete crystalbinds last for 24 hours of playtime.
More Charms for You!
Onslaught Scroll: Crit Power for You!
Nostrums of Energy for You!
Ranger's Nostrums for You!
Tanking Crystals for You!
DPS Crystals for You!
MP Crystals for You!
Defense Crystals for You!
Scrolls of Dash for You!
Warding Scrolls for You!
Use charms at a campfire to provide beneficial effects related to combat. (Remember that nearby players are also affected by the charm.)

Onslaught scrolls provide beneficial combat-related effects. For example, the Onslaught Scroll: Crit Power II that you just received increases Crit Power. Remember that although there are many different onslaught scrolls, only the last one you've used remains active.
Nostrums of energy decrease cooldowns for close-range attack skills. They are best suited for warriors, slayers, reapers, lancers and berserkers.
Ranger's nostrums decrease cooldowns for long-ranged attack skills. They are best suited for archers, sorcerers, priests, mystics, and gunners.

Threatening crystals are must-haves for lancers. These crystals allow you to gain more aggro, prompting enemies to attack you instead of your teammates. This lets your party members focus on dealing damage and healing. Right-click these crystals in your Inventory to equip them.

Carving crystals, savage crystals, focused crystals, and bitter crystals are must-haves for archers, berserkers, gunners, reapers, slayers, sorcerers, and warriors. These crystals maximize damage from your attacks to an opponent's rear! Right-click these crystals in your Inventory to equip them.

Brilliant crystals and swift crystals are must-haves for mystics and priests. These crystals help supply you with a steady supply of MP to power your support skills, as well as making you more mobile. Right-click these crystals in your Inventory to equip them.
Relentless crystals and hardy crystals can help increase your survivability. Right-click these crystals in your Inventory to equip them.

Some scrolls, when used, grant beneficial combat-related effects for a brief period of time. The scroll of dash you just received increases your movement speed to help you avoid enemy attacks. However, your timing must be precise, and the effects do not stack with other scrolls of dash.

Some scrolls, when used, grant beneficial combat-related effects for a brief period of time. The warding scroll you just received creates a barrier which absorbs enemy attacks. However, your timing must be precise, and the effects do not stack with other warding scrolls.
Stamina-rejuvenating Panaceas for You!

Did you know when your Stamina is low, your max HP, MP, charm effects, and Attack get decreased? You can use one of the panaceas you just received to immediately recover your Stamina—sort of like an instant campfire effect!
Bandages for You!
Healing Elixirs for You!

When you're not in combat, you can use bandages to start the healing process. Use these when you are low on HP and have a little breathing room. The healing effects of Verdra's Bandage end when you engage in combat, but Lelyn's Bandage doesn't.
Restore your HP by using healing elixirs. You can even use them in combat, which might prove useful to get you out of a tight spot.
Mana Elixirs for You!
Replenish your MP by using mana elixirs. You can even use them in combat, which might prove useful to get you out of a tight spot.
Scrolls of Resurrection for You!

Use a scroll of resurrection to bring a nearby fallen comrade back to life. They are particularly useful in dungeons, where the alternative is auto-resurrecting at the nearest town—and it's usually a long trip back to the dungeon.
